Effective Date: February 12, 2025
Revive Scotland ('we,' 'us,' or 'our') is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and safeguard your information when you use our website.

1. Information We Collect

We do not use cookies or tracking technologies on our website. However, we may collect personal information in the following ways:

Event Registrations: We facilitate event registrations through Eventbrite. If you register for an event, Eventbrite may collect personal and payment information according to their privacy policy. We may receive limited registration details, such as your name and email address, for event management purposes.

Donations: We provide a donation button via PayPal. If you make a donation, PayPal will process your payment and collect relevant financial information. We do not receive your payment details but may receive confirmation of your donation and your contact information if provided.

Direct Communication: If you contact us via email or other means, we may collect your name, email address, and any other information you provide.

2. How We Use Your Information

We use the limited information we receive for the following purposes:

To manage event registrations and attendance.

To acknowledge donations and express gratitude.

To respond to inquiries and communicate with you.

3. Sharing of Information

We do not sell, rent, or share your personal information with third parties except in the following circumstances:

With service providers such as Eventbrite and PayPal, as necessary to process event registrations and donations.

If required by law, to comply with legal obligations or respond to lawful requests from authorities.

4. Third-Party Services

Our website includes links to third-party services (Eventbrite and PayPal). These services operate independently and have their own privacy policies. We encourage you to review their policies before providing any personal information.

5. Data Security

We take reasonable measures to protect any personal information we receive from unauthorized access or disclosure. However, no data transmission over the internet is entirely secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security.

6. Your Rights

You have the right to:

Request access to any personal information we may have received.

Request that we correct or delete your personal information, subject to legal obligations.

Withdraw consent to our use of your information where applicable.

7. Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page with an updated effective date.

8. Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, you can contact us at.
